detailsOfAchievement: Meghshala directly impacts 102 schools, 161 teachers and around 4,680 students. Teachers who were first time tech users are now innovating different ways to use the technology. Teachers have more confidence inside the classroom. We have seen an improvement in teacher pedagogy skills- teachers are presenting content using various strategies and the classroom environment is more vibrant and engaging. Teachers have given testimonials and feedback on the increased student engagement in the classroom and improved student understanding of concepts that were otherwise difficult to teach. The Meghshala app gathers immediate feedback from users, monitors teacher usage, runs on any andriod device, works completely offline(and is online ready), and has multi-lingual capabilities.

title: Mobility India
detailsOfAchievement: National Award for Mobility India on its 20th Anniversary for â€˜Outstanding Work in the Creation of Barrier Free Environment for Persons with Disabilitiesâ€™ by Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Department of Disability Affairs, Government of India. Rehabilitation Services: Mobility India provides various developmental devices such as Standing Frame, Special Chair and Twin Device depending on the developmental status of children. These devices help aiding the functional development of children. The Assistive Devices, help the people improving their functional movements, reduce dependency on others for daily activities, access education, and income generation opportunities and lead a good quality of life. Mobility Indiaâ€™s Therapy services are targeted towards Children with Cerebral Palsy and Delayed Development (helping them to achieve developmental milestones), People with Diabetes, Stroke, Post-Polio Residual Paralysis, Spinal Cord Injury and other disabling conditions. Education & Training Programs: Various training provided at Mobility India are affiliated and recognized by: â€¢ Bachelors in Prosthetics & Orthotics â€¢ Diploma in Prosthetics & Orthotics â€¢ ISPO CAT II Certificate in Lower Limb Orthotics/Lower Limb Prosthetics â€¢ Certificate in Rehabilitation Therapy Mobility India also conducts short term courses on Wheelchair Service Provision as per WHO guidelines. The courses conducted are â€¢ Wheelchair Service Training Package-Basic Level â€¢ Wheelchair Service Training Package-Intermediate Level â€¢ Wheelchair Service Training Package-Manager Level â€¢ Wheelchair Orientation Programs in Academic Institutions Community Based Inclusive Development Programs: The scope of healthcare initiative includes awareness on health and disability issues & its management, conducting health camps, referral service for surgeries as well as provision of assistive devices & therapy services. Hygiene and sanitation also promoted through building accessible toilets. Mobility India promotes â€˜Inclusive Educationâ€™ through spreading awareness in community, orienting the school management on how to include a child with disability, making the school premises accessible as well as imparting training through Community Education Centres established across our community project areas. Promoting livelihood opportunities for people with disabilities, family members through vocational trainings, setting up of income generation opportunities as well as wage and self-employment initiatives. People with disabilities become self-reliant and contributing members of the family and community, and lead good quality of life. Capacity Building & Partnership with Grassroot Organisations: From the inception, Mobility India has partnered with grassroot organisations in building their staffâ€™s capacity, setting up of orthopaedic and physiotherapy facilities, provision of assistive devices. Over the years Mobility India has 150 partner organisations from South, East & North-Eastern States of India. Development & Promotion of Appropriate Technology: Development of Sustainable, Affordable and User-Friendly assistive devices has been at the core of Mobility Indiaâ€™s research and development activities. Unique Initiatives of Mobility Indiaâ€¦ The â€˜Accessible Mobile Vanâ€™ is a unique and breakthrough initiative of Mobility India to ensure safe and accessible commute for PwDs, especially for wheelchair users. This initiative was launched in 2000, two vehicles have been specifically remodelled to suit needs of wheelchair users while considering their safety and comfort as well. Till date 2497 accessible trips have been provided and 1072 people benefitted.

detailsOfAchievement: Educational Programme: A total number of 1500 children have been enrolled in this programme. Out of the students enrolled about 95% of the students are appearing for their examinations. One of the main features of this programme is that all children are being provided with school uniforms, books, fees and other stationeries free of cost. Value Education: Is a Unique educational programme conducted thrice a week for about 100 children. Classes are conducted separately for primary, middle and high school students. The sessions with a theoretical introduction to values and moral ethics and its practical application after which classes in spoken English, General Knowledge are being taught. Talented children participate in extra curricular activities . One of these students had an opportunity to give a Television Programme at Chennai. The main motive is to educate the children in all aspects. Health Programme: About 4000 people are registered and are benefited. There is regular check up by the Doctor once in a week, free medicines are provided. Regular awareness is given on consumption of nutritious food, hygiene etc. Includes awareness in AIDS (HIV), STD, awareness on T.B. and Medical Checkups for poor are organized. The medical checkups are made as the patient visit the clinic and hospitals and also as and when, with the help of the membership card issued to them. Women Sanghas: There are 50 Women Self Help Groups functioning under NKSST. The women conduct weekly meetings on various aspects like Self-Help Groups SHG). Benefits of SHGs: enhancement of self esteem, community development, health, hygiene, family budgeting and savings. We also Undertake Community Development Activities like â€¢ Laying of Roads, â€¢ Erecting of electrical poles, â€¢ Cleaning of drainages â€¢ Regular cleaning and spraying of DDT and â€¢ Fixing and repairing of bore wells. Public Awareness: Demonstration of Hygiene to women, youth and children who also took part in a procession organized by us to make the people of the locality understands the importance of cleanliness. We had staged dharna (Protest) for the roads to be laid, proper drainage and waste picking, which enhance public cleanliness. Provisions: In this programme, we provide 5-8 Kgs of Rice for 500 families who are very poor (who cannot afford to their basic food need) and who had acquired the membership card in our Trust. This Rice is provided on the 25th of every month. Issue of Sewing Machines: Since inception NKSST has issued 25 Sewing machines (Tailoring machines) to the underprivileged individuals. The Sewing Machines will be issued every year during the Trust annual day ceremony. Helping the underprivileged for marriages: This Trust is helping the poor who approach us for the marriage of their daughters. This is an unforeseen expense and we need a corpus fund for this purpose. Amount of expenditure is unforeseen and we have arranged corpus funds to met this expenses. Youth Wing: A youth wing is in existence since inception of the Trust to educate, guide, awareness on various activities.

detailsOfAchievement: We have strong impact outcomes as indicated by the two impact studies conducted in October 2019 and in January 2020. Children, their parents and teachers were administered a questionnaire around various life skills and non life skills parameters and were asked to rate changes they have observed in the children from the time they have joined our program. In both the clusters over 50 percent of respondents indicated high to very high changes in all 17 parameters.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: We develop life skills and creativity in village children, through sports and storytelling which we do on a daily basis. We started in July 2017 under the aegis of Sahyog Foundation a Trust registered in Bangalore, with the understanding that once we scale we will set up our own entity.This we did in Feb 2020, by setting NavSahyog Foundation a section 8 company. All our work , team, villages and beneficiaries have transitioned to it. We have raised funds from individuals and corporates.
